item.title: Huge binaries: I thunk therefore I am
item.description: In my previous post, we looked at the ‚Äúsound barrier‚Äù of x86_64 linking: the 32-bit relative CALL instruction and how it can result in relocation overflows. Changing the code-model to -mcmodel=large fixes the issue but at the cost of ‚Äúinstruction bloat‚Äù and likely a performance penalty although I had failed to demonstrate it via a benchmark ü•≤.

item.title: Running Cloud LLMs Inside LM Studio
item.description: Recently, I‚Äôve been relying heavily on LM Studio in my daily workflow, primarily for local embedding model inference. Agentic AI assistants use embedding models together with a vector database to perform semantic search over a project‚Äôs code. This setup is similar to what projects like DeepWiki1 do, but it runs entirely on local hardware. After indexing the codebase and storing the embedding vectors in Qdrant, I can start talking to the code in natural language.
